title: Entrepreneurs in History

vocab.definition: A person who starts a business and takes risks to make it grow
A new idea or way of doing something that solves a problem
A place or group where people buy and sell goods or services
A person who purchases goods or services
A person or business that offers goods or services for sale
Money earned after paying all costs
The chance of losing something when making a choice
A new device or process created to solve a problem
How much money something costs
Money a business spends to make or sell something
A person who buys goods or services
A person who represents a company to sell products
A written plan that explains a business idea and how it will work
All the money a business earns from sales
Costs a business pays for things like materials and workers
The first test version of a product
A legal right that protects an inventor's idea
A person who gives money to a business hoping it will grow
A name or symbol that makes a company or product easy to recognize
Telling people about a product so they will want to buy it

teachingNotes: Introduce what entrepreneurs do and why they matter. Highlight innovation, solving problems, and creating jobs. Use kid-friendly examples from U.S. history like Benjamin Franklin (printing), Madam C. J. Walker (hair care), and Thomas Edison (inventions and companies). Emphasize simple economics terms: market, cost, price, profit, and risk.

sample.question: What is a market?
expectedAny: place where people buy and sell

sample.question: Give one reason entrepreneurs help communities.

truefalse.question: Entrepreneurs can create jobs in a community.
Profit is the same as revenue before paying costs.
Innovation means trying a new idea or method.
All risks are bad and should always be avoided.
Madam C. J. Walker built a hair care business and trained agents.
Edison only invented things and never ran companies.
Markets are where buyers and sellers meet.

multiplechoice.question: Which best describes an entrepreneur?
choices: A person who starts and grows a business

multiplechoice.question: Which is an example of innovation?
choices: A new idea that solves a problem

multiplechoice.question: Who is known for building a hair care business and training sales agents?
Which step might an entrepreneur take first?
Which place is a market?
choices: A grocery store where people buy and sell

multiplechoice.question: Which best shows a risk?
choices: Trying a new product that may not sell

fillintheblank.question: An ________ starts a business and takes risks.
A new idea that solves a problem is an ________.
Money left after costs is called ________.
A group of buyers and sellers is a ________.
Madam C. J. Walker trained many sales ________.
Thomas Edison started companies to make and sell his ________.
A written plan for a business is a ________ plan.
Money a business spends are called ________.
A first test version of a product is a ________.
Legal protection for an invention is a ________.

shortanswer.question: Why is innovation important in business?
Give one example of a risk an entrepreneur might take.
expectedAny: advertise and it may not work

shortanswer.question: How did Madam C. J. Walker grow her business?
Name a way Thomas Edison used business to share inventions.
How could a school market work?
expectedAny: price tags and a cash box

shortanswer.question: What would you need to plan before starting a small stand?
